akn:content.akn:p: Comprehensive, multi-disciplinary assessments of children by school-based clinicians;
Authority over a management information system that enables the inter-agency exchange of information and protects familiesâ€™ privacy rights;
Facilitation of resource sharing and inter-agency collaboration on multi-disciplinary projects;
Development and implementation of proven, evidence-based preventive and interventive programs for children and families by educational, law enforcement, mental health, and social services agencies;

Development of integrated service plans for individual children and families that promote the delivery of services that are comprehensive, implemented without interruption, and free from duplication or redundancy; and
Independent evaluation of the effectiveness of the programs developed pursuant to, or in accordance with, this subchapter, including:
